Activity: Wake up, review the week's goals: systems integration (combat, economy, progression), core gameplay features (quests, crafting, character customization), and prioritize playtesting/iteration. Strategize the week's approach.
Log in to the system, check emails and company announcements. Prioritize urgent requests. Briefly browse industry news on game design trends - targeting system innovations.
Review existing system design documents for combat, economy, and progression. Identify potential integration points and conflicts. Make notes on areas requiring clarification or redesign.

Email @LDes-1 @Sdes-2 Subject: Systems Integration Meeting - Combat, Economy, Progression. Request a meeting to discuss integration strategy and address potential conflicts identified in the system design documents. Propose a meeting time for today afternoon.
Begin outlining the data flow between the combat, economy, and progression systems. Create a preliminary diagram to visualize dependencies and potential bottlenecks.
Research established third-person shooter games and their system design to find examples and inspirations. Note the advantages and disadvantages of each design.

Meeting with @LDes-1 (Lead Game Designer) and @Sdes-2 (Systems Designer) to discuss systems integration strategy. Focus on resolving conflicts and finalizing the data flow diagram. Delegate action items for specific system components.
Document the agreed-upon integration strategy, including data flow diagrams, API specifications, and conflict resolution guidelines. Share the document with the relevant teams.
Begin prototyping the integration of the combat and progression systems. Focus on the player's combat experience and how it influences character progression. Use placeholder assets initially.
Wrap up for the day. Review progress and plan for tomorrow's tasks.
